name: natural gas production, liquefied | natural gas, liquefied | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29829/documentation

This dataset describes the production of 1 m3 of ‘natural gas, liquefied’ (LNG) in Oman, and it includes the processes and services needed to run the liquefaction process of natural gas. The reference flow refers to 1 standard cubic meter of natural gas in the gaseous state.;In a liquefaction plant, the natural gas is cooled to -161 °C to reach its liquid state and the CO2 is separated. The volume of natural gas in liquid state decreases to 1/600 of the volume in gaseous state. On average 8.6 % of the natural gas input is consumed to run the liquefaction process (Pospíšil et al. 2019 in Bussa et al. 2023). The separated CO2 is usually emitted into air and not pumped back into the gas reservoir. The resulting CO2-emissions are based on the natural gas composition. The leakage rate of 0.05 %, based on Schori et al. 2012, is used to calculate the emissions of other natural gas components.;Reference(s):;M. Bussa, N. Jungbluth, C. Meili (2023) Life cycle inventories for long-distance transport and distribution of natural gas. ESU-services Ltd. Schaffhausen, Switzerland. Available from: http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/;Pospíšil J., Charvát P., Arsenyeva O., Klimeš L., Špiláček M. and Klemeš J. J. (2019) Energy demand of liquefaction and regasification of natural gas and the potential of LNG for operative thermal energy storage. In: Renewable and Sustainable Energy Reviews, 99, pp. 1-15, 10.1016/j.rser.2018.09.027.

The activity starts with the gaseous natural gas delivered to the liquefaction plant.

The activity ends with the liquified natural gas ready to be shipped. It includes the energy requirements, emissions and losses, and infrastructure for the liquefaction process. The liquefied gas is, usually, stored in a tank for 0.5-1.5 days prior shipping. Since an estimate of 9000 cycle per tank are considered, the overall balance of the tank construction and maintenance is negligible.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/352:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains/3520:Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data on energy use for the liquefaction stems of a review of common technologies from 2019. Data on leakages stem from 1990.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: During compression, the CO2 present in the natural gas mix is separated and, in general, released to the atmosphere. The practice of pump-back in the original reservoir is not common. An average value of 0.05% of leakage is taken into account (Schori et al. 2012).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: A default inventory, established based on literature, is assumed representative for all geographies.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature. Global data for energy requirements combined and natural gas characteristics.
